item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

xEnt:

forget all types of scenarios, it’s simple. ANY type of damaged cause, goes into the NPC damage pool (i call it a Syndicate) and when the NPC dies, whoever has the most damage, gets the kill. if hes offline it goes to the next person online, if its equal damage it’s a random pick. as for the EXP that gets split up depending on the amount of damage each player dealt to it.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 07, 2009, 12:29:21 am[/size][hr][quote=Kryptix]What happens if a NPC is 10hp, player A does 9hp damage and then player B comes along and hit’s a 35 on it. Does RSCA include extra damage or only the exact NPC’s HP? For example, even if you hit a 35 you will only be granted 1hp worth of XP.

and no, cut off the extra damage, only calculate by the NPC’s maximum health, if you don’t you’ll have lv 99s training on chickens hitting 25s off their 3hp and getting tons of bonus exp.[/quote]

Why did you do it like that? Wouldn’t it be simpler to

player owner; int damagetype; int damage;
Stack damage = new Stack(); On death: while(!damage.isEmpty()) { Damage d = damage.pop(); /* Handle damage logic here */ }
npc.damage.push(new Damage(player_who_did_damage, damagetype(1 for reg, 2 for range, 3 for mage), actual_damage_done));

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:2, topic:318194”]Ah alright. Well it’s easy to say ignore all scenarios but I’m picky as fuck as you already know and I like things thouroughly thought out but to be honest the end result is the same. Zilent said it’s done and has just sent me the code so I’ll give it a good testing tomorrow and report back.

Who else has done it properly xEnt?[/quote]

i dont mean ignore them all, they are all handled already if you just do what i said and calculate everything by the damage dealt, thats how it was in RSC.

and i don’t know if anyone else has done it and/or done it properly

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:1, topic:318194”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=414680.msg3052437#msg3052437 date=1260166979]
forget all types of scenarios, it’s simple. ANY type of damaged cause, goes into the NPC damage pool (i call it a Syndicate) and when the NPC dies, whoever has the most damage, gets the kill. if hes offline it goes to the next person online, if its equal damage it’s a random pick. as for the EXP that gets split up depending on the amount of damage each player dealt to it.
[/quote]

The next person online? So someone could gain someone else’s random defense XP when they login and a NPC dies?[/quote]
well no, i mean the next person thats online and has done damage to the monster

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

forget all types of scenarios, it’s simple. ANY type of damaged cause, goes into the NPC damage pool (i call it a Syndicate) and when the NPC dies, whoever has the most damage, gets the kill. if hes offline it goes to the next person online, if its equal damage it’s a random pick. as for the EXP that gets split up depending on the amount of damage each player dealt to it.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 07, 2009, 12:29:21 am[/size][hr]

What happens if a NPC is 10hp, player A does 9hp damage and then player B comes along and hit’s a 35 on it. Does RSCA include extra damage or only the exact NPC’s HP? For example, even if you hit a 35 you will only be granted 1hp worth of XP.

and no, cut off the extra damage, only calculate by the NPC’s maximum health, if you don’t you’ll have lv 99s training on chickens hitting 25s off their 3hp and getting tons of bonus exp.

Read full topic
